body_html:
Since you have the sed_hyphen_i lines lower I think the assumption is that it is not. We strip down the --action_env flag from the file instead of deleting the file. The user might do custom change to it.
…

 In configure

 :

 > @@ -9,6 +9,7 @@ SOURCE_BASE_DIR=`pwd -P`
  popd > /dev/null

  # This file contains customized config settings.
 +rm -f .bazelrc

 I am assuming ./configure is the only one who touchs .bazelrc, is that ok?

body:
Since you have the sed_hyphen_i lines lower I think the assumption is that
it is not. We strip down the --action_env flag from the file instead of
deleting the file.

The user might do custom change to it.
